message: Sunfeast Dark Fantasy by ITC launched the innovative, GenAI-enabled #MyFantasyAdWithSRK campaign in September 2023, calling on fans to create their own ads and share screen space with Shah Rukh Khan. All they had to do was upload a picture on the campaign website. The campaign went viral, with an unprecedented 9 lakh people creating their very own #MyFantasyAdWithSRK in just ten weeks! ITC’s Paperboards and Specialty Papers Business is the Asia-Pacific winner of the Special Award for Sustainability at the IDC Future Enterprise Awards 2023 regional finals. The award was given for the Business’s exemplary digital business models, and is a recognition of the fact that it has led the way in adopting a digital culture. It also honours the Business’s commitment to embed sustainability into its business strategy. The Business has been running digital and R&D initiatives to develop efficient clones, improve sapling survival and manpower productivity, reduce water consumption and improve yields, leveraging a digital suite of applications. Among these is the 'Mytree' app, designed to engage with thousands of farmers who practise agro forestry. The app is a one-stop-destination for selling saplings, sharing package of practices, advisories, getting sustainable certifications of plantations, and procuring wood. The Business has also stepped up the digitisation of data and IoT sensor use, and has been deploying automation tech in its nurseries to enhance clone productivity and in plantations for making greater economic, environmental and social impact. In IDC’s vision, the ‘Future Enterprise’ operates and invests to participate in the digital business era. The organization offers a framework for fostering a digital-first culture. #TheITCWay #sustainability #forestry #digitaltech #farmers

Loshim started her Unilever journey in 2014 as a ULIP intern in Mumbai. She joined HUL as a UFLP in 2015 which helped her understanding of the best practices in the business world, latest trends within finance & business functions across supply chain, marketing, customer development, controllership, treasury, making a strong foundation for her future. During her UFLP stint, Loshim was able to immerse herself into a manufacturing set up, international culture and business, as well as a sales stint across diverse locations, which broadened her vision as a business leader. In her first role based out of a factory in Punjab, for F&R division, she was responsible for the commercials in the foods and ice creams division. She moved to Mumbai with a role in Home care business partnering, and then worked in the GSK integration project. She also managed palm oil buying for Skin cleansing and is now leading the media finance function. In her current role, she is responsible for overseeing the financial operations and reporting for media planning and deployment. Loshim shares, “The UFLP stint gave me a kick start for my first few steps into the HUL environment of fast paced growth, great productivity and empowered me to thrive in a strong, result-oriented culture. ITC is implementing its flagship Well-Being Out of Waste (WOW) programme in Telangana, Karnataka, Delhi and Varanasi and other cities in partnership with local NGOs. In Andhra Pradesh, the Academy of Gandhian Studies (AGS) is its implementing agency, and is working to inculcate the habit of source segregation of waste among the citizens. WOW coordinators interact with school students to explain the importance of #sourcesegregation of waste. AGS coordinators in the state have already reached out to 27,46,726 children in 4,114 schools and collected waste of 12,000 MT in the past seven years. The AGS and ITC’s Paper and Speciality Products Business have plans to organise a state-level function to felicitate best performing schools and students who stood out in the project implementation. The Governor will felicitate children who contributed maximum waste to the WOW under this drive at the function to be held tentatively in January-end. We are glad to announce that ITC’s Integrated Consumer Goods Manufacturing and Logistics (ICML) Facility in Ranjangaon has been awarded the prestigious Platinum level Certification by the Alliance of Water Stewardship (AWS). The certification is a result of a rigorous on-site audit by AWS-authorised third party auditors, where the unit was evaluated on its water stewardship practices both within the facility as well as at the catchment level, on outcomes such as good water governance, sustainable water balance, water quality status and more. With this achievement, ICML Ranjangaon becomes the third ITC unit - after the Kovai paperboards factory and the Malur food factory - to receive AWS certification. It is also the sixth facility in India to be certified under AWS Standards and only fourth food and beverage production site in Asia to achieve Platinum level certification. #Sustainability #TheITCWay #waterstewardship #A4WS #Ranjangaon #awscertification

In the serene village of Wanjulshet, nestled beneath the Sahyadri mountain range, we had the privilege of spending a transformative month as part of our rural stint during our UFLP journey. Away from the relentless pace of the city, we immersed ourselves in the raw beauty of nature and connected with village life. The villagers welcomed us warmly into their lives, allowing us to gain insights into their traditional farming practices and rich cultural heritage. We lived their daily lives empathetically, gaining a firsthand understanding of the challenges they face—a true glimpse into the essence of a farmer’s life. Our exploration extended further to understanding the workings of local municipal bodies dedicated to the village’s well-being. Our journey went beyond observation, as we actively participated in social initiatives to bring about positive change. From awareness campaigns to youth counselling sessions and contributing to the education of young minds, our efforts received an overwhelming response from the community. As we said our farewells, our hearts carried the weight of deep connections and a treasure trove of memories. We hope that our efforts left a lasting impact on the younger generation and our departure symbolised not an end, but a new beginning! #UFLPdiaries #UFLP #RuralStint #managementTrainees #lifeinavillage #grassroutes #unilever #HUL #sustainableFarming #sustainableSourcing #CommunityEngagement #CulturalExchange #PositiveImpact #UniquelyUnilever

Bajarwadi, a quaint little village in Maharashtra, rests at the feet of the historic Rohida Fort, popular for its tales of glory of a young Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj who won it over towards the beginning of his political career. A month-long journey where we got to experience the pride of belonging to the village has been nothing short of transformative for all of us. We were warmly welcomed into the famed traditions Ganesh Utsav aartis and mahaprasad that the community performs as a single entity- bringing the diverse village together as family. It was a great cushion for us to interact with the locals and their family members who had migrated to megacities because of livelihoods. Getting to understand the unique dynamics between these members helped us get a grasp of the urban vs rural perspective. Meanwhile, it was also a time of fun and frolic and helped us adjust to the new realities around us. In the heart of Bajarwadi, we delved into various social projects that aimed not just at making a difference but fostering a lasting connection with the community. Our engagement ranged from career counselling sessions to water-conservation campaigns, and every project allowed us to interact intimately with the villagers. From getting to experience a different cuisine, understanding the farm-to-plate journey, seeing the variety of occupations and various social roles every section plays- we found ourselves amazed by the depth of experience of each villager. The vibrant cultural tapestry of Bajarwadi enriched our experience, creating bonds that transcended professional endeavours. We found ourselves not just implementing change but being changed in the process. As we depart, we carry with us not only memories of the projects accomplished but the indelible mark left by the resilience and warmth of the people of Bajarwadi. This transformative journey has ignited a passion within us to contribute meaningfully to the society we inhabit. Bajarwadi, with its simplicity and authenticity, has been a catalyst for personal and professional growth, leaving an enduring impact on our lives. #UniquelyUnilever #UFLPdiaries

message: Welcome to the Mahindra Kabira Festival 2023 – where tradition meets transcendence! 🎉 Join us on the mystical banks of Varanasi for an unforgettable experience from 15th to 17th December 2023. 🌟 Event Highlights: Immerse yourself in the 15th-century mysticism and poetic brilliance of Kabir during three days of captivating classical and folk music. Explore profound discussions on Kabir's wisdom, connecting the past with the present. Witness captivating art demonstrations showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the region. Enjoy unique Kabira boat rides for a distinctive festival perspective. Delight your taste buds with a local food journey, discovering the culinary treasures of the area.
